DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess safety efficacy CDB-2914 comparison levonorgestrel prevent pregnancy 5 day unprotected sexual intercourse .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy CDB-2914 Comparison Levonorgestrel Emergency Contraception
DOC.criteria: woman 16 old UK ( except Northern Ireland ) sit , 17 year Northern Ireland ( UK ) 18 year Ireland US present within 120 hour unprotected intercourse regular menstrual cycle No current use hormonal contraception Willing use hormonal method contraception study completion At least one complete menstrual cycle ( 2 menses ) post miscarriage , delivery abortion For woman present 72 hour intercourse , decline insertion IUD emergency contraception Able provide inform consent Willing abstain act unprotected intercourse study completion One act unprotected intercourse 120 hour current recent use hormonal method contraception currently pregnant breastfeed tubal ligation current use IUD Use hormonal emergency contraception since last menstrual period Current use IUD Tubal ligation Partner vasectomy Unsure date last menstrual period Severe asthma insufficiently control oral glucocorticoid Hypersensitivity active substance levonorgestrel excipients drug product use study
